oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Victoria Banks - 2018-06-16
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by songwriter Victoria Banks from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on June 16, 2018. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Victoria Banks;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (00:38) Opening comments and introduction by Kayleigh Shoemaker / (03:01) Opening comments / (03:56) Performs The Wheel / (07:13) Talks about moving to Nashville from Canada to become a professional songwriter / (08:55) Tells the story about hearing her first song on the radio and introduces the next song / (12:21) Performs Saints And Angels / (15:28) Talks about how hard it was to get another song recorded after her first hit / (17:01) Introduces the next song / (17:30) Performs unidentified song likely titled Weeping Willow / (20:28) Answers question about how many songs she's written / (21:45:) Answers question about how songs get recorded / (23:!8) Answers question about the one song she's written that mean to most to her / (24:16) Introduces the next song / (24:42) Performs The Other Side / (28:15) Answers question about her musical influences / (30:08) Introduces the next song / (31:41) Performs Heart / (34:39) Answers question about what are the steps that would help a songwriter be successful / (36:44) Answers question about thinking of herself as a solo artist / (37:27) Answers question about appearing at the Bluebird Cafe / (38:45) Answers question about which artists have recorded her songs / (40:33) Introduces the next song / (43:26) Performs Firefly / (46:48) Closing comments / (47:02) Walk-out music / (47:27) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Banks, Victoria; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
